<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ADVERTISING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/26/facebook-boycott-grows-zuck-announces-new-policy-changes?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Advertisers Swing, Zuck Dekes
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="FB boycott" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTE2L2ZiX2JveWNvdHQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday’s advertising news offers an important lesson for all younger siblings: It doesn’t matter if you didn’t start it. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As the Facebook ad boycott continued to gain momentum, consumer goods giant Unilever said it would stop ad spend on both Facebook properties <em>and</em> Twitter through the end of the year. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>These platforms need to improve “in the areas of divisiveness and hate speech during this polarized election period in the U.S.,” the company </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/5e9624fa-d121-44a9-ba84-d456385e50ab?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> in a statement. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Later in the evening, Coca-Cola said it would be <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/26/coca-cola-pauses-advertising-on-all-social-media-platforms-globally.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pausing advertising</a> on social media globally for at least 30 days, asking for more accountability and transparency from its "social media partners." This isn't part of the official boycott, but it is a big deal—it includes not only Facebook and Twitter but Snapchat and Google's YouTube. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The backstory</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Several weeks ago, civil rights groups including the NAACP, <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/martyswant/2020/06/19/as-civil-rights-groups-ask-marketers-to-boycott-facebook-outdoor-brands-pause-spending/#60f1c3456a39?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">called on brands</a> to stop spending on Facebook ads for the month of July to protest the company’s policies on hate speech and misinformation. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Outdoors companies like Patagonia, REI, and The North Face signed on early.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Other big spenders, like Verizon, jumped in later to </span><span><a href="https://gizmodo.com/the-stop-hate-for-profit-movement-isnt-going-to-stop-1844147197?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">varying degrees</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Facebook did make a few announcements yesterday. </strong>In an unusual 180, Zuck said the company will start labeling posts that violate its policies but are deemed “newsworthy”—posts from public figures like politicians, for example. Zuck also made moves to <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/26/zuckerberg-facebook-will-prohibit-hate-speech-in-its-ads.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ban hate speech</a> in ads and prevent voter suppression on the platform. He never mentioned the boycott.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Will it change anything? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before yesterday, analysts doubted Facebook would suffer any significant financial hit from the boycott. But the announcements from Unilever and Coke may have changed the calculus—for all of social media. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Shares of FB fell more than 8% yesterday, and Twitter stock also dipped 7.4%.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Facebook’s U.S. ad revenue will rise 5% this year to $31.4 billion, says eMarketer, which shows just how resilient a marketing channel it is even during a recession. But storm cells are emerging that could blow it off course. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REOPENING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/26/texas-florida-put-curbs-bars-stem-outbreaks-among-young-people?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Guy Walks Into a Bar…
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Florida masked bartender pouring a drink" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTE5L2Zsb3JpZGFfYmFydGVuZGVyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>SERGIO FLORES/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And asks for a Tito’s to go. Yesterday, Texas and Florida announced that bars would once again have to be <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/texas-close-bars-limit-restaurant-dining-due-explosion-covid-19-n1232233?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shut down</a> as officials tried to slow the rapid spread of coronavirus cases.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Texas took other measures to slow the outbreak, including putting caps on restaurant capacity and closing tubing and rafting companies.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But bars, which <em>don’t</em> lend themselves to social distancing but <em>do</em> lend themselves to slurring through “Mr. Brightside” at close quarters, have been identified as coronavirus hotspots during phased reopenings. “It is clear that the rise in cases is largely driven by certain types of activities, including Texans congregating in bars,” said Texas Gov. Greg Abbott.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Some of that is showing up in recent infection data. The </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/florida-single-day-increase-coronavirus-cases-a6d5578b-527c-4be4-88e6-eb7289a7be97.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">median age</a></span><span> of the new cases in Florida is in the 30s. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>While younger people with COVID-19 are less likely to suffer the most serious health outcomes, they could </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/25/health/florida-coronavirus-cases-young-people/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spread it</a></span><span> to people who are more vulnerable. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Thursday, the U.S. recorded <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-latest-news-06-26-2020-11593159630?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">almost 40,000</a> new COVID-19 infections—a new daily record. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
APPAREL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/26/kanye-gap-team-new-clothing-line?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
As Sales Go South, Gap Looks West
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Yeezy Gap" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTIwL3llZXp5X2dhcC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Yeezy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Kanye West, the rapper, <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9HiT3b-FJ_A&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rancher</a>, fashion icon, tweeter, and honorary Kardashian has taken his talents to the malls of America, signing a reported 10-year deal with Gap to produce a line of clothing dubbed “Yeezy Gap.” Call it the Kanye bump: Gap added $700+ million to its market cap as shares rose almost 19% yesterday. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Gap's had a rough couple of months...and years</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The rough months:</strong></span><span> Sales </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/04/gap-gps-reports-q1-2020-net-loss-shares-fall.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped 43% in Q1</a></span><span>, and it's being sued by mall landlord Simon Property Group for </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/04/the-biggest-us-mall-owner-simon-property-sues-gap-over-skipped-rent.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">skipping rent payments</a></span><span> during the pandemic.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The rough years:</strong></span><span> The rise of e-commerce and fast fashion overwhelmed the khaki shorts and t-shirt look Gap rode to prominence in the '90s. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One solution? Less khaki, more Kanye. Kanye might appear to be an odd partner for Gap, but this gives 1) an uncool retailer major style points and 2) Kanye a chance to bring his typically upscale fashion sense to the masses. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Even more style points:</strong> Kanye has tapped Nigerian-British designer <a href="https://www.complex.com/style/2020/06/kanye-west-taps-mowalola-ogunlesi-design-director-yeezy-gap?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mowalola Ogunlesi</a> to lead the new collab.</p>

</a>
</td>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/26/amazon-levels-autonomous-driving-game?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Like a Teenager Going Off to College...
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Zoox SUV" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTE4L3pvb3hfc3V2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Andrej Sokolow/picture alliance via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Amazon is exploring its autonomy. It agreed to buy <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/26/amazon-buys-self-driving-technology-company-zoox.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">self-driving car startup Zoox</a> yesterday in a deal reportedly worth more than $1.2 billion.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The self-driving space is crawling with competitors as Alphabet, Uber, Tesla, GM, Ford, and many others have shelled out the big bucks to make autonomous inroads. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Amazon said that Zoox will operate as a standalone unit within the company, but many expect the acquisition to support Amazon's never-ending quest for cheaper and faster toothpaste delivery. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Where there are cars, there's Elon</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Twitter, Musk <a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1276568125060689924?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1276568125060689924%7Ctwgr%5E&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsj.com%2Farticles%2Famazon-to-acquire-self-driving-startup-zoox-11593183986&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">called out</a> Amazon boss Jeff Bezos for being a "copy <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/cat_1f408.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">."</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Musk and Bezos </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/elon-musk-calls-for-amazon-breakup-in-latest-spat-with-jeff-bezos-11591305297?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have clashed before</a></span><span>, so it will be interesting to see the logistical and delivery expertise of Amazon pitted against the innovation chops of Tesla.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>FWIW, at least early on in their commercial life self-driving cars are expected to carry more goods than people. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Self-driving trucks with Zoox tech won't be pulling into your cul-de-sac anytime soon—CNBC reports that Amazon will likely have to spend <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/26/amazon-spending-1-billion-on-zoox-will-have-to-invest-billions-more.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$2 billion a year</a> to bring Zoox's self-driving magic to market. </p>

SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/26/nwsl-returns-utah-monthlong-tournament?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Team Sports Are Back
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="NWSL photo" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTE3L253c2xfcGhvdG8uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Streeter Lecka/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We know we have lots of National Women's Soccer League fans in the house, so be assured we’re just as excited as you are for the <a href="https://ca.style.yahoo.com/nwsl-ready-for-big-risk-big-reward-as-first-us-team-sports-league-to-return-amid-pandemic-184815629.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">return</a> of the NWSL today. The monthlong tournament in Utah represents the return of professional team sports to the U.S. after who-knows-how-long off. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In other beautiful game news…</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>On Thursday, Liverpool </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-merseyside-53187856?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">won</a></span><span> the English Premier League for its first top-flight title since 1990. #YNWA.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The 2023 Women’s World Cup will </span><span><a href="https://www.cbssports.com/soccer/news/2023-fifa-womens-world-cup-australia-and-new-zealand-joint-bid-awarded-hosting-duties-for-next/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">be hosted</a></span><span> by New Zealand and Australia.</span>
</li>
</ul>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Exercise your brain </strong>with some famous thought experiments. There’s <a href="https://theconversation.com/the-trolley-dilemma-would-you-kill-one-person-to-save-five-57111?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the trolley problem</a>, as seen in <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JWb_svTrcOg&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Good Place</em></a>, and our personal favorite: <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zO0sSJB1TrI&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">brain in a vat</a> (its progenitor is <a href="https://existentialcomics.com/comic/81?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Descartes’s Evil Demon</a>.) You can also contemplate the age-old question: Why did the chicken <a href="https://www.physics.harvard.edu/undergrad/humor?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cross the road</a>?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Saturday conversation starters, food edition:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Pineapple on pizza: Delicious or a mortal sin?</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ketchup on eggs: Tragedy or miracle?</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Milk or melk? Say it out loud. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Oat milk = Oat juice, right?</span></li>
</ul>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

SATURDAY HEADLINES

</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While the future of cities post-coronavirus has been a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/24/future-cities#utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hot topic of discussion</a>, apparently there’s already a lot of funky stuff happening in towns around the world. We assembled some stories to highlight the funkiness, but one of these headlines just ain’t true. Can you spot the fake? </p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Thousands sign petition to rename Columbus, Ohio to '</span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/21/us/guy-fieri-flavortown-columbus-ohio-petition-trnd/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Flavortown</a></span><span>' after native son Guy Fieri"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"An entire </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-26/an-entire-old-west-town-is-for-sale-but-it-s-in-new-zealand?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">old west town</a></span><span> is for sale. But it’s in New Zealand"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Arizona town of 3,765 goes </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/jUJgP8Fdvsgta/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">naked for a week</a></span><span> to protest climate change"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"A Rhode Island town has </span><span><a href="https://www.boston.com/news/local-news/2020/06/26/a-rhode-island-town-has-declared-itself-a-first-amendment-sanctuary?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">declared itself</a></span><span> a 'First Amendment Sanctuary'"</span>
</li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nAdvertisers Swing, Zuck Dekes\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"FB boycott\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday’s advertising news offers an important lesson for all younger siblings: It doesn’t matter if you didn’t start it. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs the Facebook ad boycott continued to gain momentum, consumer goods giant Unilever said it would stop ad spend on both Facebook properties \u003cem\u003eand\u003c/em\u003e Twitter through the end of the year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThese platforms need to improve “in the areas of divisiveness and hate speech during this polarized election period in the U.S.,” the company \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/5e9624fa-d121-44a9-ba84-d456385e50ab?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in a statement. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLater in the evening, Coca-Cola said it would be \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/26/coca-cola-pauses-advertising-on-all-social-media-platforms-globally.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epausing advertising\u003c/a\u003e on social media globally for at least 30 days, asking for more accountability and transparency from its \"social media partners.\" This isn't part of the official boycott, but it is a big deal—it includes not only Facebook and Twitter but Snapchat and Google's YouTube. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe backstory\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSeveral weeks ago, civil rights groups including the NAACP, \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/martyswant/2020/06/19/as-civil-rights-groups-ask-marketers-to-boycott-facebook-outdoor-brands-pause-spending/#60f1c3456a39?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalled on brands\u003c/a\u003e to stop spending on Facebook ads for the month of July to protest the company’s policies on hate speech and misinformation. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOutdoors companies like Patagonia, REI, and The North Face signed on early.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOther big spenders, like Verizon, jumped in later to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://gizmodo.com/the-stop-hate-for-profit-movement-isnt-going-to-stop-1844147197?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evarying degrees\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFacebook did make a few announcements yesterday. \u003c/strong\u003eIn an unusual 180, Zuck said the company will start labeling posts that violate its policies but are deemed “newsworthy”—posts from public figures like politicians, for example. Zuck also made moves to \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/26/zuckerberg-facebook-will-prohibit-hate-speech-in-its-ads.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eban hate speech\u003c/a\u003e in ads and prevent voter suppression on the platform. He never mentioned the boycott.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWill it change anything? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBefore yesterday, analysts doubted Facebook would suffer any significant financial hit from the boycott. But the announcements from Unilever and Coke may have changed the calculus—for all of social media. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShares of FB fell more than 8% yesterday, and Twitter stock also dipped 7.4%.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eFacebook’s U.S. ad revenue will rise 5% this year to $31.4 billion, says eMarketer, which shows just how resilient a marketing channel it is even during a recession. But storm cells are emerging that could blow it off course. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" cases in Florida is in the 30s. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWhile younger people with COVID-19 are less likely billion.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe self-driving space is crawling with competitors as Alphabet, Uber, Tesla, GM, Ford, and many style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAmazon said that Zoox will operate as a standalone unit within the company, but many expect the acquisition to support Amazon's never-ending quest for cheaper and faster toothpaste delivery. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhere there are cars, there's Elon\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1276568125060689924?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1276568125060689924%7Ctwgr%5E\u0026ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsj.com%2Farticles%2Famazon-to-acquire-self-driving-startup-zoox-11593183986\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalled out\u003c/a\u003e Amazon boss Jeff Bezos for being a \"copy \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/cat_1f408.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMusk and Bezos \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/elon-musk-calls-for-amazon-breakup-in-latest-spat-with-jeff-bezos-11591305297?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave clashed before\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, so it will be interesting to see the logistical and delivery expertise of Amazon pitted against the innovation chops of Tesla.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFWIW, at style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$2 billion a year\u003c/a\u003e to bring Zoox's self-driving magic to market. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
